result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter T Bachara Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Periodic review to begin in 18 months.  Submit DNA sample.  No contact with SMW or SDM.  Must attend sex offender treatments and any other counseling per agents recommendations.  Must comply with sex offender registry for 15 years after completion of probations.  Costs must be paid in full in the first 3 years of probation.

02:09 PM Defendant Peter T Bachara in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Petit calls defendant as witness, sworn, 2:11 P.M. direct exam by Atty Petit, Exhibit #8 marked by Atty Petit, moved and received, 2:30 cross exam by Atty Melka, 2:47 redirect, 2:51 P.M. Court questions defendant, 2:59 P.M. Witness excused, Atty Petit calls Witness Jacqueline Bachara, sworn, 3:00 P.M. direct exam by Atty Petit, 3:16 P.M. Witness excused, Atty Petit states defendant would like to withdraw his plea, State objects, Court does not find there was a breach in the plea agreement, does not find Atty Martinez as ineffective counsel, Court believes the defendant knowlingly entered the plea, Court denies the request to withdraw the pleas, Atty Petit to provide a written order, 3:50 P.M.
Filed by Atty Petit regarding update on defendants medication distribution for 2-14-20.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to prison on 1-15-19; unpaid court obligations of $518 and supervision fees of $380

10:00 AM Cases called: 15CF498, 16CF6 & 14CF417, Defendant Peter T Bachara in court, in custody with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Maura O'Connell Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Victims rights complied with. Sentencing statements made. Court addressed sentencing.  In 14CF417, 6 years prison, consisting of 3 years confinement and 3 years extended supervision. In 15CF498, 30 years prison,15 years confinement and 15 years extended supervision, consecutive to 14CF417. In16CF6 to 4 years prison, 1 year confinement, and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to the two other cases. Conditions of Extended Supervision: Remaining unpaid costs. No contact with victims or their immediate families. Ongoing counseling and AODA, per agent. No unsupervised contact with minors. 2 days jail credit in 14CF417, 805 days credit in 15CF498, 108 days credit in 16CF6. Court adj. at 11:00, Court recalled at 11:05, same appearances. Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program in all three cases. Court adj. at 11:15

Motion hearing on September 17, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Peter T Bachara in court, in custody with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Maura O'Connell Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF417, 16CF06, & 15CF498. Atty Gergen made a statement to the court. Requested the Court either allow him to move to withdraw as counsel or grant an extra day to allow him to file paperwork for writ. He did not go over the revocation paperwork with the defendant. State did not object to not going forward today. Court granted the motion to not go forward today. Defendant would like atty Gergen to stay on this case.  Atty Gergen is to file the paperwork by the end of this week. Counsel is to meet with Br. 3 JA to set a date for the writ hearing.

Defendant Peter T Bachara in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF06, 16CF48, 15CF498, and 14CF417.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to 15CF498, Ct. 3 of 16CF06, and Ct. 2 of 14CF417.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  All other charges in all cases were dismissed and read in.  16CF148 Dismissed and read in. In 16CF06, 15CF498, and 14CF417, Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation on all counts for 5 years.  Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample, No contact with SMW or SDM.  Must attend sex offender treatment and any other counseling per the agents recommendations.  Must comply with sex offender registry for 15 years after completion of probation.  $518.00 costs each count. (In 15CF498 costs are to be paid in the first 3 years).  1 year conditional jail time in 15CF498, starts forthwith.  Periodic review to begin in 18 months. 14CF417 2 days jail credit.  16CF06 108 days jail credit.  11:15/11:52.
